---
title: "Terrain Integrated Rough-Earth Model (TIREM) - MATLAB"
---
# Overview

The package name to install is `tirem`.  The package can be found in the matpak repo with the following command:

```
matpak search tirem
```

## Installing Package

Use the following command to install `tirem` from the matpak repo:

```
matpak install tirem
```

The packag can be installed directly into your working directory or in a seperate directory that you include in your execution path.

## Documentation

All `tirem` functions are docummented with detailed headers, such as:

```matlab
% Function Invoke(...)
%
% Description: Calculates the propagation loss between antennas
%       using the Terrain Integrated Rough-Earth Model (TIREM)
%       software
%
% Inputs:
%   h_tx__meter : Transmitter structural antenna height (0.0 to 
%       30,000.0), in meters
%   h_rx__meter : Receiver structural antenna height (0.0 to 
%       30,000.0), in meters
%   f__mhz : Transmitter frequency (1.0 to 275,000.0), in MHz
%   heights__meter : Array of profile terrain heights above mean 
%       sea level (-450.0 to 9000.0), in meters
%   distances__meter : Array of great circle distances from the 
%       beginning of the profile to each profile point, in meters
%   N_s : Surface refractivity (200.0 to 450.0), in N-Units
%   sigma : Conductivity of earth surface (0.00001 to 100.0), 
%       in S/m
%   epsilon : Relative permittivity of earth surface (1.0 to 100.0)
%   humid : Surface humidity at the transmitter site (0.0 to 
%       110.0), in gram/m^3
%   polarization : Transmitter antenna polarization
%
% Outputs:
%   A__db : Total path loss (Basic transmission loss), in dB
%   A_fs__db : Free space loss, in dB
%   mode : Mode of propagation
```

# Examples

**Note:** These examples use an artificial terrain profile.

## Basic Transmission Loss

```matlab
heights = [4.5, 7, 3.6, 8, 10, 5];
dists = [0.0, 10000, 20000, 30000, 70000, 200000];

h_tx__meter = 5;
h_rx__meter = 6;
f__mhz = 1755;
N_s = 301;
sigma = 0.005;
epsilon = 15;
humid = 50;

[A__db, A_fs__db, mode] = TIREM.Invoke(h_tx__meter, ...
    h_rx__meter, f__mhz, heights, dists, ...
    N_s, sigma, epsilon, humid, TIREMPolarization.Vertical);

% A__db = 204.60               // basic transmission loss, in dB
% A_fs__db = 143.35            // free space loss, in dB
% mode = 3                     // Troposcatter
```

## Absorption Loss

```matlab
heights = [4.5, 7, 3.6, 8, 10, 5];
dists = [0.0, 10000, 20000, 30000, 70000, 200000];

h_tx__meter = 5;
h_rx__meter = 6;
f__mhz = 1755;
N_s = 301;
sigma = 0.005;
epsilon = 15;
humid = 50;

[A__db, A_fs__db, mode] = TIREM.Invoke(h_tx__meter, ...
    h_rx__meter, f__mhz, heights, dists, ...
    N_s, sigma, epsilon, humid, TIREMPolarization.Vertical);

% A__db = 204.60               // basic transmission loss, in dB
% A_fs__db = 143.35            // free space loss, in dB
% mode = 3                     // Troposcatter

abloss = TIREM.GetTiremAbloss();

% abloss = 0                   // absorption loss, in dB
```

## Diffraction Loss

```matlab
heights = [4.5, 7, 50, 8, 10];
dists = [0.0, 10000, 20000, 30000, 70000];

h_tx__meter = 5;
h_rx__meter = 6;
f__mhz = 1755;
N_s = 301;
sigma = 0.005;
epsilon = 15;
humid = 50;

[A__db, A_fs__db, mode] = TIREM.Invoke(h_tx__meter, ...
    h_rx__meter, f__mhz, heights, dists, ...
    N_s, sigma, epsilon, humid, TIREMPolarization.Vertical);

% A__db = 168.82               // basic transmission loss, in dB
% A_fs__db = 134.23            // free space loss, in dB
% mode = 2                     // Diffraction

totdif = TIREM.GetTiremTotdif();

% totdif = 168.82              // diffraction loss, in dB

% you can also get the diffraction loss for a troposcatter path
heights2 = [4.5, 7, 3.6, 8, 10, 5];
dists2 = [0.0, 10000, 20000, 30000, 70000, 200000];

[A__db2, A_fs__db2, mod2e] = TIREM.Invoke(h_tx__meter, ...
    h_rx__meter, f__mhz, heights2, dists2, ...
    N_s, sigma, epsilon, humid, TIREMPolarization.Vertical);

% A__db2 = 204.60              // basic transmission loss, in dB
% A_fs__db2 = 143.35           // free space loss, in dB
% mode2 = 3                    // Troposcatter

totdif2 = TIREM.GetTiremTotdif();

% totdif2 = 208.20             // diffraction loss, in dB
```

## Troposcatter Loss

```matlab
heights = [4.5, 7, 3.6, 8, 10, 5];
dists = [0.0, 10000, 20000, 30000, 70000, 200000];

h_tx__meter = 5;
h_rx__meter = 6;
f__mhz = 1755;
N_s = 301;
sigma = 0.005;
epsilon = 15;
humid = 50;

[A__db, A_fs__db, mode] = TIREM.Invoke(h_tx__meter, ...
    h_rx__meter, f__mhz, heights, dists, ...
    N_s, sigma, epsilon, humid, TIREMPolarization.Vertical);

% A__db = 204.60               // basic transmission loss, in dB
% A_fs__db = 143.35            // free space loss, in dB
% mode = 3                     // Troposcatter

tottro = TIREM.GetTiremTottro();

% tottro = 204.60              // troposcatter loss, in dB

% you can also get the troposcatter loss for a diffraction path
heights2 = [4.5, 7, 50, 8, 10];
dists2 = [0.0, 10000, 20000, 30000, 70000];

[A__db2, A_fs__db2, mode2] = TIREM.Invoke(h_tx__meter, ...
    h_rx__meter, f__mhz, heights2, dists2, ...
    N_s, sigma, epsilon, humid, TIREMPolarization.Vertical);

% A__db2 = 168.82              // basic transmission loss, in dB
% A_fs__db2 = 134.23           // free space loss, in dB
% mode2 = 2                    // Diffraction

tottro2 = TIREM.GetTiremTottro();

% tottro2 = 192.23             // diffraction loss, in dB
```

## TX Troposcatter Angle

```matlab
heights = [4.5, 7, 3.6, 8, 10, 5];
dists = [0.0, 10000, 20000, 30000, 70000, 200000];

h_tx__meter = 5;
h_rx__meter = 6;
f__mhz = 1755;
N_s = 301;
sigma = 0.005;
epsilon = 15;
humid = 50;

[A__db, A_fs__db, mode] = TIREM.Invoke(h_tx__meter, ...
    h_rx__meter, f__mhz, heights, dists, ...
    N_s, sigma, epsilon, humid, TIREMPolarization.Vertical);

% A__db = 204.60               // basic transmission loss, in dB
% A_fs__db = 143.35            // free space loss, in dB
% mode = 3                     // Troposcatter

alphae = TIREM.GetTiremAlphae();

% alphae = 0.010916            // tx troposcatter angle, in radians
```

## TX Horizon Index

```matlab
heights = [4.5, 7, 3.6, 8, 10, 5];
dists = [0.0, 10000, 20000, 30000, 70000, 200000];

h_tx__meter = 5;
h_rx__meter = 6;
f__mhz = 1755;
N_s = 301;
sigma = 0.005;
epsilon = 15;
humid = 50;

[A__db, A_fs__db, mode] = TIREM.Invoke(h_tx__meter, ...
    h_rx__meter, f__mhz, heights, dists, ...
    N_s, sigma, epsilon, humid, TIREMPolarization.Vertical);

% A__db = 204.60               // basic transmission loss, in dB
% A_fs__db = 143.35            // free space loss, in dB
% mode = 3                     // Troposcatter

horztx = TIREM.GetTiremHorztx();

% horztx = 2
% tx horizon point is dists(2) and heights(2)
```
